name: Breakfast Favorites
ingredients: 1 ½ cups liquid like water, milk, or juice (can add more or less depending on how smooth you want your smoothie to be)
1 ½ to 2 cups of your favorite fruits, fresh or frozen
½ cup Greek yogurt (plain or flavored)
½ cup ice for more liquid and texture
- 1 tsp chia seeds and/or flax seeds
instructions: 1. Combine liquid, fruits, Greek yogurt, and ice in a blender. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Add optional add ins as desired. 4. Enjoy your customizable smoothie!

name: Chocolate Banana Breakfast Shake
ingredients: 1 serving of Carnation Instant Breakfast, Ovaltine, chocolate protein powder or other chocolate powder that can be added to milk
Small handful of nuts (walnuts, almonds, or pecans are delicious)
instructions: Put all ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth (it will remain slightly lumpy because of the oats and nuts). Enjoy your chocolate banana breakfast shake!

name: Vanilla-Peach Smoothie
ingredients: 1 ½ cup orange juice, or as much as needed
2 cups unsweetened frozen sliced or chopped peaches
instructions: 1. Put the yogurt, juice, vanilla, and banana in the blender first, followed by the peaches. 2. Pulse blender to start, then turn on high to smooth. If the mixture is stiff, add more liquid. 3. Serve right away.

name: Multi-Fruit Smoothie
instructions: Combine strawberries, blueberries, banana, kiwi, spinach, ice cubes, fat-free milk and apple juice in blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Green Monster Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup fat-free milk (or milk of your choice)

name: Overnight Oats
ingredients: 2/3 cup milk of choice (if using soy, rice, almond, or another non-dairy milk use unsweetened)
1 tbsp. chia seeds or ground flax seeds
Up to 2 tbsp. honey or maple syrup
Optional Mix-ins (fruit, nut butter, cocoa powder, coconut, nuts)
instructions: 1. Mix all ingredients in a bowl or in the jar you’ll be storing them in. Pour or spoon the mixture into the storage container. 2. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, but up to 8 hours (usually overnight) for best results. 3. Overnight oats can be eaten cold or heated in the microwave.

name: Peanut Butter Overnight Oats
ingredients: ½ cup unsweetened plain almond milk (or milk of your choice)
2 tbsp. natural peanut butter, almond butter, or nut butter of your choice (can be creamy or chunky)
1 tbsp. maple syrup (can substitute for your preferred sweetener)
Optional toppings (bananas, strawberries, other fruit, granola, ground flax seeds or chia seeds)
instructions: 1. Mix all ingredients together. 2. Put mixture into a storage container with a lid. Make sure the oats are covered by the milk. Store in the refrigerator overnight. 3. Add extra toppings right before eating. Can be eaten cold or warmed in the microwave.

name: Instant Oatmeal Packets
ingredients: Ideas for toppings: dried fruit, fresh fruit, canned fruit, nuts, seeds, mini chocolate chips, peanut butter, jam, etc.
instructions: 1. Blend dry rolled oats in a blender, pulsing until oats are powdery. 2. In a mixing bowl combine powdery oats and remaining ingredients. 3. To use, combine ½ cup instant oatmeal and 2/3 cup water in a microwaveable bowl and microwave for 2 minutes. Add toppings if desired. 4. If desired, put mix into individual baggies, ½ cup in each. Makes 6 packets.

name: Tasty Toast
ingredients: Toast toppings of choice (jam, cheese, fruit, vegetables)
instructions: 1. Spread nut butter on a slice of toast. Put sliced bananas on top and drizzle with honey. 2. Cook an egg as desired. Mash avocado and spread it on toast. Place the egg on top and sprinkle with salt and pepper. 3. Top toast with hummus and cooked veggies. 4. Spread Nutella on toast and top with sliced fruit. 5. Spread low-fat herbed cream cheese on toast and top with sliced cucumbers. 6. Get creative with your toast toppings using ingredients you have on hand.

name: Frozen Breakfast Burritos
instructions: 1. Scramble the eggs and sauté the potatoes and green peppers. Cook the bacon or sausage. 2. Soften tortillas in the microwave. 3. Lay out tortillas and add filling ingredients. Roll up and wrap in plastic wrap, then place in a freezer bag. 4. In the morning, heat in the microwave until warmed.

name: Boiled Eggs
instructions:
1. Fill a pot with about 4-5 cups of water (or more if your pot is larger) to cover the eggs completely.
2. Bring the water to a boil.
3. Carefully add the eggs to the boiling water with a spoon.
4. Boil for 10 minutes for hard-boiled eggs, 8-9 minutes for slightly softer yolks, or 6-7 minutes for soft-boiled eggs.

name: Pancakes
instructions: 1. Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. 2. Combine egg, milk, and oil in a separate bowl. Add to flour mixture and stir until blended. 3. Cook on a hot, greased skillet to make about eight 4-inch pancakes.

name: Basic Muffins
ingredients: ¼ cup sugar or mashed ripe bananas
instructions: 1. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. 2. Combine milk, oil, and egg in a separate bowl. Add to flour mixture and stir. 3. Bake in muffin tins for grab-and-go breakfast or snack.

name: Blueberry Muffins
ingredients: ¾ cup fresh or frozen blueberries
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 °F. 2. Mix dry ingredients together well. 3. In a separate bowl, mix milk, oil, and egg. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. 4. Pour in the wet ingredients and stir until moistened, leaving the mixture slightly lumpy. 5. Fill sprayed muffin pans about 2/3 full. Bake 20-25 minutes. Makes 10-12.

name: Cranberry Orange Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup fresh, frozen, or dried cranberries
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 °F. 2. Mix dry ingredients together well. 3. In a separate bowl, mix milk, oil, and egg. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. 4. Combine cranberries, sugar, and orange zest. Fold into batter. 5. Fill sprayed muffin pans about 2/3 full. Bake 20-25 minutes. Makes 10-12.

name: Pumpkin Muffins
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 °F. 2. Mix dry ingredients together well. 3. In a separate bowl, mix milk, oil, egg, and pumpkin. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. 4. Stir cinnamon and nutmeg into flour mixture. Pour in the wet ingredients and stir until moistened, leaving the mixture slightly lumpy. 5. Fill sprayed muffin pans about 2/3 full. Bake 20-25 minutes. Makes 10-12.

name: Waffles
instructions: 1. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking powder, and salt. 2. In a small mixing bowl beat egg yolks with a fork. Beat in milk and cooking oil. 3. Add wet ingredients to flour mixture and stir until blended but still slightly lumpy. 4. In a smaller bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. 5. Gently fold beaten egg whites into the flour-milk mixture. 6. Pour batter onto preheated waffle iron. Makes about 7 round waffles or 3 nine-inch waffles.
